result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Lydell Tarleton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allen Lydell Tarleton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Allen Lydell Tarleton.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/28/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Allen Lydell Tarleton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Allen Lydell Tarleton.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen Lydell Tarleton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Allen Lydell Tarleton.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen Lydell Tarleton in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Cleghorn, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference date to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.D.A. (dob 10/5/2003) and S.L.K. (dob 10/17/1981) and S.L.K.'s minor children.
  No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Allen Lydell Tarleton in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Allen Lydell Tarleton
Current: 8521A W Hampton, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 07-11-2022)
Prior: 2727 North 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/11/22 @ 2:30p
